column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: In 2023, REA India hosted its leadership conference - 'REA India Leadership Conclave' - focusing on sharing strategic vision and the theme 'Power of One.' The conclave included panel discussions and presentations on key FY24 initiatives and future growth opportunities for the business.
column20: REA India Leadership Conclave, leadership conference, panel discussion

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
column13: The annual Australian HR Awards are the leading independent awards event for the HR profession in Australia, and in FY23, REA was recognised as an HRD 5-Star employer of choice. This award recognises REA for leading its approach to leadership, recruitment, work-life integration, reward and recognition.
column20: 5-Star Employer, HR Award, independent award

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
column13: REA India won two accolades at the 2023 HR Distinction Awards by the HR Association of India. REA India was recognised for 'Best Employee Retention Policy' and 'Top Rewards & Recognition Program'. These honours underscore REA India's culture shaped by employee feedback and industry-first benefits such as flexible work options, learning and growth opportunities, comprehensive rewards and inclusive health initiatives that extend to employees' families.
column20: HR Distinction Awards, HR Association of India, REA India

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
column13: REA's Advantage program delivers real value and fosters personal and professional growth for real estate professionals. REA empowers positive change and strengthens local communities by supporting over 30,000 property professionals through exclusive events, educational programs, well-being initiatives, industry sponsorships, and community grants,
column20: Advantage program, professional growth, real estate professional

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: In FY23, REA partnered with The Field, a job site designed to connect candidates who live with disabilities with jobs from inclusive employers. REA assembled a squad to work on assessing its existing procedures and identifying those touch points that would require change to ensure its hiring practices were inclusive and accessible for candidates who live with disabilities. Through this work, REA changed the language in its job ads, the careers pages on its website, and its job applications and processes for interviewing candidates.
column20: The Field, disability, inclusive employer

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: In FY23, REA was a major sponsor of the Tech Diversity Foundation, including sponsoring the Tech for Good Award at the annual TechDiversity Awards. In FY23, TechDiversity launched the Tech Diversity Academy, and REA Group had representation in the inaugural cohort of participants.
column20: Tech Diversity Foundation, Tech for Good Award, TechDiversity Award

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Diversity is particularly important in REA's business because its products and services must engage consumers in every market and sector. Because REA is a truly global company operating in Australia, Asia and North America, REA should reflect the diversity seen in those consumers. REA's Diversity and Inclusion Policy puts REA in a better position to understand and respond to the needs of these groups and, in turn, is an investment in creating a sustainable and enduring business that can deliver long-term shareholder value.
column20: Diversity and Inclusion Policy, diversity, sustainable business

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Amaze is the peak body for autistic people and their supporters in Victoria. REA has partnered with Amaze to create an Autism & Neurodivergent Positive Employment Program. Over the next two years, REA will support Amaze in developing learning modules, a job board, an employer support line, and a community of practice to tap into neurodiverse talent.
column20: Amaze, learning module, Autism & Neurodivergent Positive Employment

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: In FY23, over 100 people managers from REA India attended gender workshops aimed at addressing biases at work, promoting an inclusive culture, and exploring ways to achieve DE&I goals. Through insightful activities, role plays, videos, and case studies, the workshops emphasised the practical application of DE&I concepts, including shifting mindsets, fostering acceptance, and normalising inclusion and collaboration.
column20: Gender workshop, inclusive culture, DE&I

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: REA Group Australia and REA India celebrated International Women's Day with various activities. In Australia, keynote speaker Ashleigh Streeter-Jones, former Forbes 30 Under 30 & AFR 100 Women of Influence, discussed closing societal gaps and combating systemic inequality. In India, female-identifying employees attended a financial freedom webinar, along with the launch of a #EmbraceEquality social media contest and LinkedIn feature on 'Women of REA India'.
column20: International Women's Day, systemic inequality, financial freedom

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Aspire is Mortgage Choice's talent nurturing program for the women in its broking network. Aspire was developed in response to the Mortgage & Finance Association of Australia (MFAA) Opportunities for Women report, which showed declining female representation in the broking industry.
column20: Aspire, a talent nurturing program, woman

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Through REA University, REA facilitated DE&I programs, including Trust & Psychological Safety, Imposter Syndrome, Fighting Gender Balance at Work, Becoming a Male Ally, and Inclusive Behaviours workshops. An Inclusion Calendar was created with the employee Diversity Guild, featuring key DE&I dates. REA's partnership with Corporate Mental Health Alliance Australia provided access to over 60 online well-being sessions addressing diversity sub-group issues.
column20: DE&I programs, Inclusive Behaviour workshop, Inclusion Calendar

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: To honour World Pride and the Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras, REA engaged its people in developing a virtual pride float, displaying photos of its LGBTQIA+ employees, allies and supporters on digital displays in REA's offices. Spectrums group organised celebrations and networking in REA's Melbourne and Sydney offices, while REA's Flatmates business donated to Minus18 charity for every Full Plan sold during the month.
column20: Virtual pride float, World Pride, LGBTQIA+

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column13: REA conducted a comprehensive pay parity review, considering role type, tenure, job family, community of practice, and compensation grade. Internal analysis of REA's Australian pay data has shown its current enterprise median pay gap has moved to -1.00% in FY23, meaning that REA's female median pay is now higher than its male median pay. It is a shift from 0.04% in FY22 and 0.16% in FY21. REA will continue to focus on achieving parity across genders.\t
column20: Pay parity review, median pay gap, compensation grade

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column13: In June 2023, Rohit Hasteer, REA India's Chief Human Resource Officer, authored an article for SightsIn Plus magazine, stressing the significance of inclusivity and the crucial role allies play in promoting equitable and just treatment for the LGBTQIA+ community. He underscored the importance of creating a safe and inclusive work environment where all employees can thrive authentically.
column20: SightsIn Plus magazine, inclusivity, LGBTQIA+

column4: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column13: REA Group's Supplier Code of Conduct sets out the minimum standards suppliers require regarding workers' rights and human rights, anti-bribery and anti-corruption laws and other laws concerning business integrity, privacy, health and safety, and environmental considerations. Suppliers must also have adequate policies and procedures in place to monitor compliance with these laws and must ensure that any authorised sub-contractors also comply with these minimum standards.
column20: Supplier Code of Conduct, supplier, human right

column6: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column13: REA Group has controls that reduce the risk that it could inadvertently employ individuals who are under the minimum working age. In REA Group's Australian operations, an underage candidate would be identified through its new employee screening process, including through the interview stage, completion of tax authority forms or photo identification provided by candidates.
column20: Control, underage candidate, employee screening

column6: Operations and suppliers ar significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
column13: In FY2022, REA Group engaged Elevate, a leading provider of sustainability and supply chain services, to conduct social audits of two suppliers based in China and the Philippines. The suppliers provide outsourced software development and outsourced administrative support for REA Group's Australian businesses, respectively. The social audits followed the Elevate Responsible Sourcing Assessment (ERSA) methodology.
column20: Elevate, sustainability, supply chain service

Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In FY23, REA commenced the development of its first Reflect Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP), which was submitted to Reconciliation Australia for review in June 2023. The RAP was led by REA's Organisational Development function, with input from a multi-disciplinary working group around REA Group. REA's work began with Journey Begins Workshops, facilitated by its Reconciliation Action Plan Advisor, Eddie Moore, as a way of building cultural awareness of First Nations history and culture.
column20: Reconciliation Action Plan, Reconciliation Australia, Journey Begins Workshop

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: REA empowers its people to support community organisations and causes that matter to them through its Because We Care program. The program has been running in Australia since 2014 and was refreshed in FY23 based on employee feedback through surveys and focus groups. REA focuses on three areas: matched workplace giving program participation, volunteer leave uptake, and reward and recognition for community work.
column20: Because We Care program, community organisation, employee feedback

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: REA introduced the 'Double Matching in May' giving program, where REA Group doubled its contribution by matching $2 for every $1 donated by employees. REA also created a volunteer portal on its intranet, offering numerous volunteering opportunities, and introduced a volunteer assignment in REA's Leadership Now program.
column20: Double Matching in May, donation, volunteer portal

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: The Mortgage Choice Charity Foundation (MCCF) was established on July 1, 2022. In FY23, with a $150,000 contribution from REA Group and combined fundraising efforts, the MCCF raised $346,160. A significant portion, $73,967, was donated to the national charity RizeUp, benefiting 3,200 families and 6,552 children escaping family and domestic violence.
column20: Mortgage Choice Charity Foundation, fundraising, domestic violence

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Providing education opportunities for mortgage broking customers empowers them with the knowledge to make informed decisions and enhances their experience of REA. This year, REA partnered with Humbli, a digital financial experience and education provider, to create a series of educational videos for consumers focused on refinancing Ã¢ÂÂ a topic that's top of mind for many borrowers in the current economic environment.
column20: Humble, mortgage broking, educational video

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In March 2023, REA Group continued its annual support for Anglicare Australia's 2023 Rental Affordability Snapshot. The Snapshot analyses rental listings across Australia to assess the affordability of renting a home for low-income people. It is achieved by taking a snapshot of the thousands of properties listed for rent on realestate.com.au and testing whether each rental listing is affordable and suitable for individuals with low incomes.
column20: Rental Affordability Snapshot, Anglicar Australia, rental listing

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: REA Group has adopted further due diligence measures for suppliers with a higher inherent modern slavery risk. Based on REA's risk assessment criteria, in FY2022, a Supplier Assessment Questionnaire was sent to approximately 4% of REA Group Australia tier-one suppliers. The same questionnaire was sent to 10% of REA India suppliers. The questionnaire comprises 20 questions relating to the policies and procedures of the supplier, their supply chain visibility, modern slavery responsibility, training programs, response processes and employment conditions.
column20: Supplier Assessment Questionnaire, due diligence, inherent modern slavery risk
